Posts.Content: Ronnie22 wrote: Hello Ladies I wanted to give an update on my biopsy last Friday and everything is B9.  To say the least the waiting game is enough to put anyone in a rubber room.  Having a procedure done on a Friday is the worst option due to the weekend, but thankfully everything came back fine.  I know many of you are in that middle ground of not knowing and I felt obligated to post so that you know that I am part of the 80% rule.  Keep this in mind while waiting that 80% of lumps are B9, this is what I have learned on this site over and over again.  This is actually the only thing that kept me going for the last several days in addition to Xanax-lol-Don't be afraid to ask for that either from your Doctor.  Also, if you are facing the waiting game please post your thoughts and feelings as this discussion board will offer support and compassion.  I have lurked, lurked and lurked and obsessed on every detail on these boards, my life had actually stood still since Friday.  I am not sure if was healthy, but I am sure it kept my mind occupied and definitely made me feel not so alone and just a little in control.  Sure I had my crying jags, hid from kids and basically kept this to myself except for a few close friends, but this site allowed me to express my fears without shame. Thanks to all of you who continue to offer assurance, knowledge and compassion to every new poster.  I noticed that there are many who are first to offer support and empathy to new timers like myself even though you are diagnosed.    I am not much of poster but have scrubbed these boards so much I feel like I know you all deeply.  Your good works go farther than you can ever imagine.  TO FIRST TIMERS-REMEMBER THE 80% RULE.  And here's to more B9's. Much Love Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results-80% rule Ronnie22 omg333

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2012 03:01PM Ronnie22 wrote: leelee-you're doing the right thing and taking the steps.  Don't do this to yourself and I know easier said than done.  You will have a hard couple of days, but it's only because of "not knowing" and nothing is confirmed.   Try to just stay in your moment without creating your own movie, we have a tendancy to do that.  You are worried over "fear" and don't let fear control your life.  "Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy." (Leo Buscaglia) "Worry is like a rocking chair, it will give you something to do, but it won't get you anywhere." (Anonymous) Hang in there sweetie and keep posting and venting.  We have been there.
Posts.Title: so worried I have breast cancer leelee101 leelee101

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2012 12:25PM Ronnie22 wrote: Geauxwest-Interenet land can be good and bad as we all know.  Hang in there and remember the 80% rule as odds are in your favor.  I also had a needle guided biopsy based on a "hard mass" with a bi-rads of 4a.  Although I was cleared, I have very dense breast and have a feeling this is not the end for me and I will probably facing more biopsy's moving forward.  I am one of those that get called back for more views with 6 month follow ups, I am only 43.  Please post your results when you have them.  Here's to being B9.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results-80% rule Ronnie22 omg333

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2012 04:43PM Ronnie22 wrote: Ugggghhhhhh-I am so trying to keep myself together right now.  I am having a low point and very weepy.  DH is taking me to dinner tonight and how the hell am I going to be able to do this.  I have been on the computer all day and I mean all day, reading thru post of those like me and were not B9.  Someone please give me peace.  This is the cross that I will bear for the rest of my life and if I slip thru this I have a feeling it will be a constant battle of test and waiting.  I am so sorry as I know some of you are dealing with the diagnosys and I have yet and may be in the clear.  Everyone is telling me that everything will be fine, but I am not buying it.  I am fearing the worst.  Thanks for your encouraging words, it means so much.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today and Scared Ronnie22 Ronnie22

Posts.Content: Ronnie22 wrote: Today is a new day and I slept well, probably because of the 3 glasses of wine I had.  I had my biopsy yesterday morning and the waiting has been so difficult for me.  My sister had given some xanax and I think I will take some just to be functional. I feel like I can't breathe, my stomach hurts and my world is standing still.  I honestly can't believe I am going thru this.  I need to get a grip and keep in the moment and stop creating my own movie.  I find myself one minute fine the next in tears, boy do I hate being so self focused. Thank you all for responding to my rant, I needed it and find this place so supportive.  Wishing all the best in the waiting period. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting Club Day 2 Ronnie22 vballmom

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2012 06:22AM Ronnie22 wrote: Soyaandpepper-Thanks so much for prayers.  Today is day 4 and I had it done Friday, they said Tues/Wed.  I am trying to stay focused but it is very difficult.  I still tear up and I am very weepy and for the most part have stayed away from google.  I will keep you posted.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today and Scared Ronnie22 Ronnie22

Posts.Content: Ronnie22 wrote: I am new here and compelled to share.  I had my first biopsy today (ultra sound needle guided) and of course I am a nervous wreck and can't focus, eat, sleep and so on.  One minute I am fine and the next I am losing it completely.  I was so weepy during the procedure that it was almost awkward.   On Monday I had a 6 month follow up Mammogram and ultrasound and they found a hard solid mass that was not there before.  I have very dense breast and they said 3 regarding size and not sure if it was CM or MM.  My doctor was very assuring and positive and told me she is 80-90% sure this is nothing, but biopsy is recommended.   When making my appointment I ask what the birad was and the scheduler told me 4a.  I am a little comforted about that, but to be honest I am barely holding on.  I am literally hiding from my kids (9 and 11) so they don't see me weepy.  It's amazing, I am a very playful person, but I am so self-consumed right now I can't seem to remember to reach for God. I will be 44 on Sunday and since getting mammograms I seem to be the one constantly called back.   I can't stomach the fact of more biopsy's and mammograms in the future. Thanks for reading and wish you all B9 results. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today and Scared Ronnie22 Ronnie22
